definition: to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to get straight to the point (idiom)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to return something to its rightful owner
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
